Description: Moses returns to Egypt with wife and sons; Moses and wife at left, leading donkey on which two small children sit in basket, accompanied by German biblical verse to Exodus 31 in letterpress; printed to face the antetype of Joseph leading Virgin and Christ into Egypt; illustration to Peter Perenyi and Augustin Hirschvogel, 'Vorredt und eingang der Concordantzen alt und news Testaments, durch Pereny Petri... Und nachuolgents durch Augustin Hirßfogel... erweytert' (Vienna, Aegidius Adler: 1550). 1549 Etching and letterpress
Curator's comments: Bound in the second edition of the complete book with original embossed binding with evangelist portraits, and two-page preface, 56 pages with 104 etchings. Two etchings to a page with German letterpress above and below with relevant biblical passages; see 1926,0617.13.1-104 for the book. For the antetype facing this print, see 1926,0617.13.19.
Bibliographic references: Hollstein / German engravings, etchings and woodcuts c.1400-1700 (134b)
Paisey 2002 / Catalogue of German printed books to 1900 (306)
Associated titles: "Vorredt und eingang der Concordantzen alt und news Testaments, Durch Pereny Petri... Und nachuolgents durch Augustin Hirßfogel... erweytert"
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Gan, C. (sold by Boerner in Leipzig, May 1926)
